line_1: Strange, yet a truth, and gains upon belief,
line_2: That joy excessive hurts as much as grief.
Now forgot, and devote me to grief?

line_1: A terror-breathing tale that wins belief,

line_2: And man of all the chief;

line_1: With a false Name impose on your Belief:
line_2: Strangely, my Thoughts, ye let this cozening Grief

line_1: O! live; and let thy Works urge our Belief;
line_2: Live to explain thy Doctrine by thy Life;
When to involve me with consummate Grief,

line_1: To Kings Presumption, and to Crowds Belief.
line_2: Fear to the Statesman, Rashness to the Chief,

line_1: That courts make rogues is my belief,
line_2: As 'tis the mill that makes the thief.

line_1: The blackness of thy crime exceeds belief;
line_2: And fills both men and maids with keenest grief!

line_1: Enough to propagate the sure Belief,
line_2: That Vice engenders Shame; and Folly broods o'er Grief.
